New Records: Tarik Skubal became the fourth Detroit Tigers left-hander with 200 strikeouts in a season, joining Hal Newhouser, Mickey Lolich, and Matthew Boyd
Key Match Events: Tarik Skubal allowed one run in eight innings, pitching a strong game to honor the 1984 World Series championship
The Tigers celebrated the 1984 World Series victory with a 2-1 win over the Red Sox
Pre-Game Insights: Manager A.J. Hinch emphasized the importance of the bullpen performance
Red Sox manager Alex Cora noted Tarik Skubal's dominance
Post-Match Reflections: Manager A.J. Hinch praised Tarik Skubal's performance
Red Sox manager Alex Cora acknowledged Skubal's potential Cy Young win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was significant as it honored the 1984 World Series champions
The attendance was 34,355 fans at Comerica Park
Others: The Tigers moved within 1.5 games of Boston in the American League wild-card race
Rich Hill was the only player born when the Tigers last won the World Series
